abstract.text: A class your Metal app uses to register for callbacks to synchronize its animations for a display.

inlineContent.text: instances are a specialized way to interact with variable-rate displays when you need more control over the timing window to render your app’s frames. Controlling the timing window and rendering delay for frames can help you achieve smoother frame rates and avoid visual artifacts.
When working with less visually intensive apps or apps which don’t use Metal, use
Your app initializes a new Metal display link by providing a target
property to an implementation that encodes the rendering work for Metal to perform. With a set delegate, synchronize the display with a run loop to perform rendering on by calling the
Once you associate the display link with a run loop, the system calls the delegate’s
method to request new frames. This method receives update requests based on the
of the display link. The system makes a best effort to make callbacks at appropriate times. Your app should complete any commits to the Metal device’s
for rendering the display layer before calling
Your app can disable notifications by setting
. When your app finishes with a display link, call
to remove it from all run loops and the target.

abstract.text: An instance you use to create, submit, and schedule command buffers to a specific GPU device to run the commands within those buffers.
Presents the drawable onscreen as soon as possible.
Render, compose, and animate visual elements.
Returns the current absolute time, in seconds.
A timer object that allows your app to synchronize its drawing to the refresh rate of the display.
Methods that model a hierarchical timing system, allowing objects to map time between their parent and local time.
A function that defines the pacing of an animation as a timing curve.
A class your Metal app uses to register for callbacks to synchronize its animations for a display.
Stores information about a single update from a Metal display link instance.
Registers the display link with a run loop.
An instance of a type your app implements that responds to the system’s callbacks.
Creates a display link for Metal from a Core Animation layer.
Removes the display link from all run loops for all modes.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system suspends the display link’s notifications to the target.
The amount of time, in frames, your app requests to render a frame.
A range of frequencies your app allows for frame updates, affecting how often the system invokes your delegate’s callback.
Removes a mode’s display link from a run loop.
A protocol your app implements to respond to callbacks from Core Animation for a Metal display link.
A method the system calls to notify your app when it plans to update the display.
A Core Animation layer that Metal can render into, typically displayed onscreen.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
